member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider
member.summary: Represents the AzMan authorization provider. Authorize method checks to see if the specified identity has access to a task.
member.remarks: Supports Windows authentication only. Requires AzMan on Windows Server 2003, or Windows XP users will need to install the Windows Server 2003 Administration Pack. Implements the interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.Authorize(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified authority against the specified context that is either a task or operation in Authorization Manager. If the context is an operation it should be prefixed by "O".
member.param: Principal object containing a windows identity.
Name of the task or operation to evaluate.
member.returns: True if AzMan evaluates to true, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.CheckAccessTasks(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData,System.String,System.Security.Principal.IIdentity,System.String[])
member.devdoc: Checks access to specified a set of tasks in a specified application in a specified scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.CheckAccessOperations(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData,System.String,System.Security.Principal.IIdentity,System.String[])
member.devdoc: Checks access to specified a set of operations in a specified application in a specified scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.GetClientContext(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData,System.Security.Principal.IIdentity,System.String,Microsoft.Interop.Security.AzRoles.IAzApplication@)
member.devdoc: Gets the client context for the call based on the identity, system and parameters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData
member.summary: Represents the configuration settings for the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for AzManAuthorizationProviderData. Use this constructor when you know only the name of the AzManAuthorizationProvider you are creating

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.param: Location of the authorization store, Active Directory or xml file
Audit identifier prefix to prepend to the generated audit identifer
Optional name of the application scope

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData.StoreLocation
member.summary: Location of the authorization store, Active Directory or xml file.
member.remarks: Absolute file paths are required for xml storage. View this link for more information about the expected format http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/security/security/azauthorizationstore_initialize.asp.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData.Scope
member.summary: Optional name of the application scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.AzManAuthorizationProviderData.AuditIdentifierPrefix
member.summary: Audit identifier prefix to append to the generated audit identifer.
member.remarks: The audit identifier is generated to be "prefix username:operation"

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the provider.

value.para: The type name of the provider. The default is an empty string.
